title.narrative: Piloting a systemic approach for decentralized drinking water services in Homa Bay County, Kenya

description.narrative: Together with the Homa Bay County government we set out a pilot to inform the development of 85 improved water sources in the county. Currently the improved drinking water sources are not providing water of adequate quality, nor are they embedded in the functioning of the social- and ecological system. Our aim is to change this, we adopt a systemic approach in which we implement a model that is based on stewardship and regenerative processes. We invest in the deployment of high-tech water treatment solutions, capacity building in water management, the establishment of a stewardship model and the regeneration of the environment through agroforestry and agroecology. By doing so we create a lively community-based platform for the continuous development of water management and related fields.In this project we pilot our approach at two locations in Oyugis, Homa Bay County. We create a decentralized drinking water service to provide the population with high quality drinking water from the first day of operation and for many years to come. We expect to provide up to 10,000 citizens with high quality drinking water, thus mitigating current unsustainable consumption patterns. Additional impacts are expected, like knowledge transfer, employment of youth, mitigation and sequestration of Co2 emissions and the stimulation of local economy.
